issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: We added the ability to not allow the browser to save the user's password as a configurable parameter for the console, but when this is turned on, the username is also being cleared. We still remember the account name, and should also be remembering the username.
fields.summary: forced clearing of password field is also clearing username field on login screen

comments.body:
We only turnoff autocomplete on the password field. We only remember the account name in a cookie. The username is left to the browser's password save feature. If we don't have password save on, it looks like the username isn't remembered.
It seems like an option might be to also save the username in a cookie. I suspect that would trigger password retrieval if password save was enabled.

cc [~jloza]
FWIW this doesn't happen to me on Chrome.

on Safari, there is a different behavior. It fills in acct/password, but leaves username blank. Seems like this is all browser specific. [~jloza], should I try to remember the username like the account, or just leave it alone?

If you can remember the username, please do. 

We probably need, for usability's sake, to not rely on the browser for this but go back to our "Remember me" functionality that we had prior to 4.0...we need a separate ticket for that, though, to target for 4.2.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1119

I tested on Chrome, FF and Safari on OS X. In all cases, once you login/logout, the username is now remembered.

Now, when I log out on Chrome and FF, the username is filled in, but the PW is blank, even though I have my browsers set to remember it. I have to erase and re-enter the username to get the password to fill in. Did not test on Safari. 

Video attached to show you exactly what is happening.

As we discussed in chat, I'm just not seeing that. I'm using Chrome 38.0.2125.111 on OSX 10.7.5.
Maybe we can get others to verify this? Can we reassign for review?
I am using chrome Version 38.0.2125.111 on OSX 10.10. I also see the exact same behavior on FF 32.0.3. Happy to have someone else verify the behavior they see.
re-assigning for verification. Please list version as we did above, and outcome. Thanks!

[~dkavanagh][~jloza] When tested on FF33.0.3 on OS X, with the server option,

browser.password.save = false

, logging out from the console cleared out both the user name and password fields.
Ignore my comment above. It was tested on 'develop' branch. It needs to be retested on GUI-700 branch.

[~dkavanagh] [~jloza] When tested on GUI-700 branch, after clearing the cache on Firefox, the clearing of the username on the login page after logging out was no longer seen. Also tested on Chrome, the username was preserved on the login page after logging out.
I assigned back to Jenny to close if she's content with this.
UX review passed, ready for code review.

Tested in browsers Firefox, Chrome, and Safari.  Usernames were preserved in all cases.
